history.content:
If you can eat pretty quickly (in 10 min bc Berkeley Time), you can eat between labs. Here's the thing, you don't need to attend Data 8 lab so long as you have finished the assignment before a specified time (will be mentioned in lecture).  In the 16A labs, they don't allow food but in the lab section I assisted for Data 8, allowed students to eat food. You might not need all the scheduled time to finish the labs, so if you finish early you can leave. There is no cafeteria in Soda but yes the restaurant outside of Soda is open at 2.

NOTE: Every class/lab/discussion starts BerkeleyTime (10 minutes later from scheduled time) at Cal.

Hope I answered all your questions!

--------

As someone who had similar schedules past semesters with giant blocks of back-to-back classes, I would add that waking up earlier to have a big/healthy breakfast is 100% worth it and pays off to get you through the first part of your day. Also always keeping healthy/energizing snacks that you can eat quickly during breaks so that you're never running on a completely empty stomach. It's definitely manageable once you get into the rhythm of your schedule!

If you can eat pretty quickly (in 10 min bc Berkeley Time), you can eat between labs. Here's the thing, you don't need to attend Data 8 lab so long as you have finished the assignment before a specified time (will be mentioned in lecture).  In the 16A labs, they don't allow food but in the lab section I assisted for Data 8, allowed students to eat food. You might not need all the scheduled time to finish the labs, so if you finish early you can leave. There is no cafeteria in Soda but yes the restaurant outside of Soda is open at 2.

NOTE: Every class/lab/discussion starts BerkeleyTime (10 minutes later from scheduled time) at Cal.

Hope I answered all your questions!

children.subject: I used to have a schedule like that and I began to practice fasting on that day...

history.content:
thanks to a forced lab move today, my EE16A lab has now been moved to Thu 11am.  That means I'll have classes straight from 9:30am-4:00pm (9:30 EE16A lecture, 11am EE16A lab, 2pm Data 8 lab), with the distinct possibility of going from 9:30am-6:30pm since I was supposed to be in discussion for CS61A at 11am. 

So a set of naive questions.  0) is there enough time between labs to eat?  Both the 11am and 2pm labs are in Cory 1) is it a big deal if I'm late for the Data 8 lab by 10 minutes if I have to eat at 2pm?  2) do they allow food in the labs (I assume no)  3) is the cafeteria in Soda open at 2?
history.subject: scheduling questions
